raw: * This mixin allows easily adding handlers for context menus on table columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This mixin allows easily adding handlers for context menus on table columns.

raw: * Add a handler for a context menu which is initiated in a specific
*   The column number in which the context menu request originated
*   The function to call when a context menu request originates in the
*   specified column. The handler is called with the following arguments:
*       The number of the column in which the right click was issued
*       The number of the row in which the right click was issued
*       The table in which the right click was issued
*       Complete data model of the table
*       Menu in which buttons can be added to implement this context menu
*   The function must return a (Boolean), indicating whether the context
*   menu should be shown or not. The context menu will be shown when the
* handler function returns true. When the handler function
* returns false the context menu will not be shown.
*   Optional execution context for the callback (i.e. "this").
*   If not provided, the {@link qx.ui.table.Table} object this mixin is

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a handler for a context menu which is initiated in a specific column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
col {Integer}
   The column number in which the context menu request originated
@param.description: The column number in which the context menu request originated

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
handler {Function} The function to call when a context menu request originates in the specified column. The handler is called with the following arguments:
  • column: (Integer) The number of the column in which the right click was issued
  • row: (Integer) The number of the row in which the right click was issued
  • table: {@link qx.ui.table.Table} The table in which the right click was issued
  • dataModel: {@link qx.ui.table.model.Abstract} Complete data model of the table
  • contextMenu: {@link qx.ui.menu.Menu} Menu in which buttons can be added to implement this context menu
The function must return a (Boolean), indicating whether the context menu should be shown or not. The context menu will be shown when the handler function returns true. When the handler function returns false the context menu will not be shown.
@param.description:
The function to call when a context menu request originates in the specified column. The handler is called with the following arguments:
  • column: (Integer) The number of the column in which the right click was issued
  • row: (Integer) The number of the row in which the right click was issued
  • table: {@link qx.ui.table.Table} The table in which the right click was issued
  • dataModel: {@link qx.ui.table.model.Abstract} Complete data model of the table
  • contextMenu: {@link qx.ui.menu.Menu} Menu in which buttons can be added to implement this context menu
The function must return a (Boolean), indicating whether the context menu should be shown or not. The context menu will be shown when the handler function returns true. When the handler function returns false the context menu will not be shown.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {Object?this}
   Optional execution context for the callback (i.e. "this").
   If not provided, the {@link qx.ui.table.Table} object this mixin is
   applied to is used.
@param.description:
Optional execution context for the callback (i.e. "this").
   If not provided, the {@link qx.ui.table.Table} object this mixin is
   applied to is used.

raw: * Return the registered context menu handler for a column.
*   The column number for which the context menu handler is requested
*   The handler function which has been registered for the specified
*   column. The arguments of the handler is documented in

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the registered context menu handler for a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
col {Integer}
   The column number for which the context menu handler is requested
@param.description: The column number for which the context menu handler is requested

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Function}
   The handler function which has been registered for the specified
   column. The arguments of the handler is documented in
   {@link #setContextMenuHandler}.
@return.description:
The handler function which has been registered for the specified
   column. The arguments of the handler is documented in
   {@link #setContextMenuHandler}.
